Udaloy
Storozhevoy
Bessmennyy
Sovremennyy

Yak-38 Forger
Su-24 Fencer C
Ka-25 Hormone A
Ka-27 Helix
56280.name: Ship Forms

56281.name: My First Picture Pairs
56281.description: My First Picture Pairs is a game for preschoolers designed to help them with the memory in a simple matching game. Face down cards are arranged in a grid and players turn them over to find matches. The pictures on the cards are large, bright, and colorful so that children can easily differentiate between them.

56282.description:
An expansion for 3rd Edition Harpoon, it contains pre-made aircraft, submarine, and ship forms of 10 different countries as well as an ASW scenario generator and playing aids for ASW scenarios.

It includes the following forms:

Canada - Iroquois class, CH-124 Sea King
France - Amethyste class, Georges Leygues class, Le Redoubtable class, Tourville class
FRG - Bremen class, Hamburg class, Lynx Mk88
Japan - Chikugo class, Yushio class, Imp. Yushio class, Shirane class
Norway - Oslo class, Type 210 class
PRC - Han class, Luda class
Sweden - Goteborg class, Nacken class, Vastergotland class
UK - Leander/2TA class, Vanguard class
USA - Arleigh Burke class, Lafayette class, Ohio class
USSR - Delta III class, Delta IV class, Grisha III/V class,
Kashin class, Mirka II class, Pauk class, Yankee I class
56282.name: ASW Forms

56283.description:
An expansion for the 3rd Edition Harpoon, it contains pre-made submarine forms for 7 different countries, and over 35 submarines.

It includes:

USA - Barbel class, Los Angeles class, Imp. Los Angeles class, Narwhal class, Permit class, Seawolf class, Skipjack class, Sturgeon class

USSR - Akula class, Alfa class, Charlie I class, Charlie II class, Echo II class, Echo II Mod class, Foxtot class, Juliett class, Kilo class, November class, Oscar I class, Sierra class, Tango class, Typhoon class, Victor III class, Yankee SSN class

UK - Oberon class, Swiftsure class, Trafalgar class, Upholder class, Valiant class

French - Agosta class, Daphne class, Rubis class

Italian - Salvatore Pelosi class, Nazario Sauro class, Enrico Toti class

FRG - U-13 class, Type 211 class

Dutch - Zwaardvis class
56283.name: Sub Forms

56284.name: Funny Phonics
56284.description: Funny Phonics is a sequel to the children's sentence game, Silly Sentences. This edition adds a 12 sided dice and a spinner indicating what type of word may be used (adjective, noun, verb, etc). Players form sentences with word and picture cards. These are generally intended to be silly, such as "The smug teapot met the yellow cat."

56285.name: Adventurers Club (Issue 24 - Summer 1994)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Words with the 1993 Kumite Champion
56285.description:
User Summary:

Adventurers Club #24 appeared in Summer 1994. It features a Fantasy Hero article and cover art with Dr. Destroyer.

Departments

- 'Nuff Said by W.D. Robinson
- Superhype! by Bruce
- Crooks & Crusader: Martial Arts inspired by U.M.A. by Steve Long
- GM's Discretion: Steve takes on racial package deals by Steve Perrin
- N-Ray Vision: Review of Darkurthe Legends from Black Dragon Press

Features

- SWARM!" How to write up insect and other swarms for the HERO System by Curtis Craddock
- Battle at Castle Rockwell: An Adventure for Fantasy Hero by Brian J. Hotovec
- Building Your Own Corporation: The Co-Author of Corporations Tells How To Do It by Mark Arsenault
- Kumite!: Background and Rules for the Second Annual GenCon Kumite! by Scott Sigler
- A Few Words with the 1993 Kumite Champion by Rob Otto
- Bustin' Broncos: Breaking Wild Horses in Western Hero by Jon Bricker
- New Martial Arts: Three New Martial Arts Styles to Liven Up Your Games! by Greg Lloyd

56286.description: My First: What's My Job? is a children's educational game designed to help children associate objects with the jobs the people who use them and to help stimulate conversation. Game cards feature pictures of children acting out jobs such as Teacher, Fireman, and Singer as well as the objects they use. Players must match these cards together. For example, the fireman would match with the fire extinguisher, the singer would match with the microphone, and the teacher would match with the chalkboard. The player with the most matches is the winner.
56286.name: My First: What's My Job?

56288.name: The Compleat Spell Caster
56288.description:
From the back cover:

"Featuring Rules for the

Witch
Warlock
Mystic
Necromancer
Sorcerer
Sage




As Player or Non-Player Characters
Adaptable to Most Fantasy Role-Playing Games

Plus New Information On:

Familiars
Summoned Creatures
The Hierarchy of Demons
Runes
Symbols
Circles of Protection
Strange Artifacts
Major Arcana




And More..."

56289.name: The Power Gamer's 3.5 Warrior Strategy Guide
56289.description:
Subtitled: The 100% Official Guide to Kicking Monster Butt and Winning the Game.

From the back cover:

"You're looking at the first strategy guide for the revised edition of the world's most popular role playing game. Let's be real - the game's about combat, not charisma! This strategy guide gives you the strategies and techniques you need to win. It's like a football coach's playbook, or a video game champion's cheat codes. Feat combos, sneaky skill uses, multiclassing secrets, and abusing the rules: that's what it's all about."

56290.name: The Power Gamer's 3.5 Wizard Strategy Guide
56290.description:
Subtitled: The 100% Official Guide to Kicking Monster Butt and Winning the Game.

From the back cover:
"Pick the wrong spells and you'll be pushing up daisies. Pick the right ones and you'll be racking up XP. This book is all about making the right decisions to build the perfect magic user. Whether you're a wizard, sorcerer, or other arcane spellcaster, if you're interested in combat. you'll learn how to max out your abilities."

56291.name: The Complete Guide to Beholders
56291.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold: the ultimate resource for the ultimate monster. With enough material to sustain a campaign for years, the Complete Guide to Beholders offers a completely new perspective on this misunderstood monster. Far more than simply a book of new options, this work is a transformation of the beholder. It expands their social structure and cultural life in new ways, forever changing the way you play them. Inside you will find:

A comprehensive look at the different varieties of beholders, including the nation-like Dominions by which they separate themselves, the differing ideologies of each Dominion, and stats for more than a dozen variants, including the Eyetouched template.
An eye-opening look at beholder cultists and their infiltration of humanoid civilizations, including everything you need to play a cultist or one of the beholders' corrupted eyekin servants.
A detailed guide to creating memorable beholder encounters, adventures, and long-term campaigns, covering tactical advice for combat, maps of common beholder lair designs, and new classes, feats, equipment, and magic items just for beholders.
New player options for fighting against beholders, including new classes, spells, and organizations.
And much more, all of it compatible with the 3.5 revision, with free bonus material available online.

56293.name: Farm Counting Fun
56293.description: Farm Counting Fun is a children's educational game that teaches simple math skills like addition and subtraction. Players have a bingo style board and draw cards with images of animals and farm foods on them. Cards are placed on the board according to how the numbers add up. The first player to fill their board is the winner.

56294.description:
In Jungle Speed, you must rely on your keen sense of observation and quick reflexes in order to rid yourself of cards and win the game.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards, and players take turns revealing one card at a time in separate piles. If two face-up cards are identical, those players must make a grab for the totem in the center of the table. The faster player then gives his face-up cards to his unfortunate adversary. To add to the difficulty, certain cards are almost identical, which can trick a hapless player into grabbing the totem by mistake. Whoops! Mess up like this, and you must take the face-up cards of all opponents. Other cards force all players to grab for the totem at once or otherwise change game play.

Jungle Speed: Rabbids adds a few twists to the basic Jungle Speed game, starting with a "Raving Rabbids" character that sits atop the token. If a player grabs this Rabbid – even when someone grabs the totem by mistake – she can give a card from her face-down stack to the player of her choice. Other cards have players race to create rabbit ears on their head or grab the Rabbid without knocking over the totem. Another special card forces everyone but the active player to close their eyes, while the active player moves the totem to some point on the table within reach of everyone; the other players (with eyes still closed) then race to find the totem first using only their hands. Don't gouge your neighbor too much!
56294.name: Jungle Speed: Rabbids

56295.name: Very Silly Sentences
56295.description:
Very Silly Sentences is a sequel to Silly Sentences.

From the publisher:
Learning basic language and literacy skills to give children a head start as they start school is as easy as A, B, C with this fun game.

Colour-coded cards will help your child learn parts of speech and sentence construction with hilarious consequences. The banana jumped over the tree, the cow ate the alarm clock. No sentence is too silly in this addictive game for the whole family.

56296.name: Silly Rhymes
56296.description: Silly Rhymes is a sentence making game similar to Silly Sentences. In this game though, the words in the sentence have to rhyme. Players place word cards in a row to form funny rhyming sentences such as, "The fat cat pats a hat" and "The smug bug hugs the rug." The winner is the first player to discard all their words.

56297.name: Rough Magicks
56297.description:
From the website:

IÄ! IÄ! YOG-SOTHOTH NEBLOD ZIN!

The latest eldritch tome for Trail of Cthulhu unfolds the darkest secrets of Lovecraftian magic to the shuddering gaze of Keepers and Investigators alike! Read it ... if you dare!

MAGIC AND MYSTERY

This book assembles the core of Lovecraftian magic from hints and allusions -- and blasts all certainty aside with twelve contradictory explanations for it! Keepers revel in a dozen new spells, and dubious new versions of some old spells, while Investigators find out what their abilities tell them about this stone circle in the woods ...

MAGIC AND MAYHEM

Using the new optional Magic ability has its own costs, and its own rules, revealed for the first time to a quailing humanity! Gain it how you will, from a grinning Nyarlathotep or a groaning tomb, you will never be the same again. Even the lore of Idiosyncratic Magic, strange fruit grown from the seeds planted in the Trail of Cthulhu corebook, will bleed you while worse things wait ...

MAGIC AND MONSTERS

Learn the sorcerous practices of the unthinkably alien and ancient beings of the Cthulhu Mythos, or scan the dizzying heights to which even human wizards may
ascend! Poring over this dread work reveals all of this, plus variant Elder Signs, names to conjure with, and other ...
ROUGH MAGICKS!

56298.name: ERPS
56298.description:
User summary:

This is the main rulebook for ERPS, containing character creation, combat rules, magic rules, the campaign setting and a 60-page adventure

56299.name: Durch das Land der Eisschlösser
56299.description:
User summary:

"Durch das Land der Eisschlösser" (Through the land of the Ice Castles) describes the northern parts of the campaign world Doria. It also includes three adventures.

56300.name: Angeli
56300.description:
User Summary:

Angeli is a German supernatural RPG centered on the conflict between heaven, hell and other supernatural forces. Players can assume the roles of angels, demons, humans, elves and sidhe, vampires, golems or other creatures.

Characters are either created in a completely free-form manner or based on templates which can be modified randomly or using a point pool.

This book contains the main rules and the campaign setting for "angeli".

56301.name: Köln vor dem Abgrund
56301.description:
User summary:

"Köln vor dem Abgrund" (Cologne in front of the Abyss) is an adventure module for angeli. Dark creatures try to drag the souls of the Cologne citizens to their doom. Only the characters can stop them.

56302.name: Player's Guide
56302.description:
Website blurb:

Four Colors is a superhero rpg set in the bygone era of the 1940's, when heroes were heroic and villains were villainous.

So, leave behind the angst-ridden comicbooks of today and fight the good fight against Nazi's, gangsters and twisted theme villains! Once you go Four Colors, you'll never want to go back!

56303.name: Gamemaster's Guide
56303.description:
User summary:

The Gamemaster's Guide gives information and advice about running a Four Colors campaign.

The first section: "Rules and Stuff" gives some rules for special situations and methods of character advancement.

The second section: "Gamemastering in the Golden Age" gives information on running a Four Colors campaign. Conventions for the genre, to help set the tone of the game. How to set up Issues (session/scenario), Series (campaign), and Master Villains.

56304.name: Companion
56304.description:
User summary:

The Four Colors Companion is a book of play options for Four Colors. The book is divided into three sections:

Section One: Optional Rules
Specialties, Another Use for Stunt Points, Called Shots, Wrestling, and Charge Attacks

Section Two: Quick Characters
Rules for quickly generating characters, intended for creating NPCs.

Section Three:
GM's Corner
Rules for Lifting and a set of stats for Stock Characters.

56305.name: Warpstone (Issue 29 - Summer 2009)
56305.description:
Contents:

Editorial (John Foody)

Reviews (Toby Pilling, Steve Moss, Dan Wray, Dark Knight of the Twisted Moon)

I Am Not an Adventurer! - Writing scenarios for groups of careers (Francois Dube)

Fragments - Brief reviews and news

The Collapsing Empire - The persecution of the Old Faith, Dwarfs and Wizards by the Drak Wald Emperors (Alfred Nunez Jr. and Anthony Ragan)

Womb of the Gods - The creation of the Gods & Other Matters (Robin Low)

Dead Man Walking - Musings on the Undead (Toby Pilling)

Ghost Stories - Ghosts in WFRP (Clive Oldfield)

Saint Olaf's Shrine - A Temple of Verena (Robin Low)

Dangerous Ingredients - Scenario (Roysten Crow)

"A System of Complex Signalling Machines" - A guide to using the sempahore system of the Empire (Alexander J. Bateman)

Beneath the Surface - Scenario (Michael Madsen)

Joust for Fun - The Great Nuln tournament (David Perry)

The Haunting of Westenseite Mine - Scenario (Toby Pilling)

Zoats - Expanded background (Robin Low)

56306.name: Sitzkrieg
56306.description:
Sitzkrieg is an expansion set for Axis and Allies which includes a new board sized 80 x 150 cm, an Excel based IPC-tracker, printable battleboards and a PDF based printable rules set.

The set comes without plastic figurines, so you need at least any of the Axis and Allies games with all major powers present or spare parts from Xeno Games to have enough figurines for all nations. The playable nations are: Germany, Italy, Japan, USSR, Chinese Communist Party (CCP) Kuomintang (KMT), France (Free & Vichy), Netherlands, neutrals and Britisch Commonwealth Nations divided into UK, Canada, South Africa, India and Australia.

The map offers you geographical features such as rivers and mountains that have their own influence on the units. When set up, the game starts with a couple of events that took place before 1939. You have to roll for the Second Sino-Japanese war and for the Spanish Civil War to start with. The Long March, The purge and the Winter War all take place in what is called turn zero.Starting turn 1 you may roll for nation specific technologies. Urban Warfare, Burma Road, Lend Lease, Convoys, International and Territorial Waters, Ports, Elite Infantry, Partisans, Spanish Blue Division, Political Leaders are elements that enhance the realistic feel of the game.

The goal is to win a bronze, silver or gold (historical) victory over your enemies.

Rules for which Axis and Allies and Xeno pieces can not be used:
-Weather effects like rain, heat, snow, fog and wind effect your troop's mobility. You can make your own weather markers or use the Litko Aerosystems weather markers.
-Oil Derricks (we recommend Petropolis pieces) and oil drums (we recommend the supply counters from Axis and Allies Battle of the Bulge)
-Commanders (we recommend 1/72 scale minis, Table Tactics jeeps or Axis and Allies miniatures commanders) Commanders allow surrender or retreat options.
-Elite Infantry (we recommend 1/72 scale minis or AA Miniatures

To get all the miniatures to play all the rules is a bit of work, but remember you can also use them to make house rules for your regular Axis and Allies games or use the Sitzkrieg rules as an expansion to your own games.

56307.name: 4C System
56307.description:
From the introduction:

4C is a RPG toolkit rather than complete game system; it provides a foundation for you to build upon. As presented, 4C is speciically for superhero roleplaying though it could be adapted to other genres with a bit more work.

User summary:

This is the core rules book for the 4C system. It includes a book of rules and the required master chart. The system appears to be an open reimplementation of the FASERIP system used by Marvel Superheroes.

56308.name: My First Board Game
56308.description:
My First Board Game is a simple game for even the youngest players. Children turn over a tile and more to the color-coded space. Everyone wins! Colorful illustrations feature characters from Suzy's Zoo.

Desigen as an Early Learning System, the bookshelf series becomes progressively challenging as a child matures from ages 2 to 4 and up. The games are sized for small hands and easily fit on a bookshelf. They are safe for Toddlers to Tots... there are no small parts.

The delighful characters of Little Suzy's Zoo bring the game to life!

56313.name: Grand Prix Jumping
56313.description:
In Grand Prix Jumping the players take on the roles of riders leading their steeds through a Grand Prix competition course which includes fences of varying rail heights, as well as a water jump. Getting through the course fast will help your cause but will not guarantee victory as the winner is not the horse that finishes fastest but the one with fewest fault points.

You design the course before each game so the strategy will change with each play. You can make the course as demanding as you want. While Grand Prix Jumping is at its heart a card game, there is very little luck involved and the better skilled rider will be victorious.

56315.name: From Stone to Steel
rpghonor: 2003 ENnie for Best Rules Supplement - Runners Up
rpgissuearticle: Review of From Stone to Steel
56315.description:
Subtitle: A d20 System Guide to Arms & Armor from the stone-age to the Renaissance.

From the back cover:
"From the dawn of history, mankind has made war. In every age and civilization, people have developed tools of warfare. From the remotest primitive tribe to the greatest empire, every culture has created weapons for hunting, protection, conflict, and defense against the same. The record of history measures their successes and failures. No campaign world could ever hope to be as varied and diverse as our own. Despite fantastic races and locations, every fantasy world recycles themes mirrored in our own histories, myths, and culture. But many cultures go unnoticed or un-examined in role playing games. Many games become limited by our narrow views of what fantasy is, and can be.

No longer.

'From Stone to Steel' is a book of weaponry and armor, but it is also an examination of history and cultures. From age to age, every culture has approached similar ends and concepts with its own unique perspective. 'From Stone to Steel' is not merely a simple list of items, but rather an explanation of their use, their cultural significance, even their drawbacks. Besides weapons and armor, 'From Stone to Steel' contains new feats, new skills, new prestige classes, and new mechanics. Through each chapter, topics like tactics, special materials, training, and culture are discussed, so that they can be understood and placed in any campaign world. And though these items are based in history, suggestions are made for their inclusion in fantasy world. You'll even find items of myth, fantastic construction materials, new spells to augment weapons and armor, even inclusion of fantasy racial items (based, where possible, on myth or legend).

From stone-age primitives to the height of the Renaissance, history is in your hands. 'From Stone to Steel' - Never look at d20 gaming the same way again!"

56316.name: Tutela
56316.description: Players control groups of postilions, who have to arrive to their goals as soon as possible. Each hex on the board has a number on every side; a roll of a die decides which direction a postilion can leave. The first player wins who arrives with all his/her postilions to their goals.

56317.name: OGL Ancients
56317.description:
From the back cover:
"Welcome to the past that never was. OGL Ancients is a role-playing game set in a world long past, where Greek heroes do battle with hideous monsters and artificers work mechanical miracles, while priests petition the Gods for their divine intervention. Witches weave spells in secret glades under the full moon and the spirits of the dead really do revisit the living and wicked spectres lurk in the pestilent places of the earth. This is an environment that many will not have ventured into before. Instead of taverns, castles and dungeons, the setting is one of great temples, amphitheatres, pyramids and hanging gardens, where wise or corrupt kings rule over their sprawling empires and wars are fought for the hand of one beautiful queen.

Set before the rise of the Roman Empire, OGL Ancients focuses on the two most influential civilisations of the ancient world, the Egyptians and the Greeks. Drawing upon historical depictions of weapons, armour, equipment and societal structure of other, more fantastical and mythical elements, such as the wrangling of the Gods and the emergence of colossal monsters in keeping with the strong fantasy of this heroic golden age of myth.

If you have ever wished to sail with Jason on the Argo, to dare the labyrinth in the footsteps of Theseus or to twist men's bodies into the shapes of swine like Circe; if you would besiege the white walls of Troy or fly amid the clouds on winged sandals. If you would learn the secrets buried in the hearts of the pyramids meet with the witches on lonely mountains then venture forth as something greater than the Iliad is born...

The world of OGL Ancients is one where true heroes are remembered forever and where a man favoured by the Gods can rise from the humblest of beginnings to command the world."

56318.name: Mischief  & Mayhem! (Revised Edition)
56318.description:
Publisher's description:

For years, players of fantasy games have stormed the dungeons and strongholds of evil sorcerers, warlords, and just plain bad guys as heroes: knights, wizards, druids, paladins, and more. Heroically they have braved the darkest pits, the foulest creatures, and the most perilous of quests.

This, however, is not such a game.

Welcome to The Imp Game, Mischief & Mayhem! Rather than taking on the role of one of these namby-pamby heroes, players in the Imp Game take on a much more entertaining role: that of the common, dungeon imp! Servants of a wannabe dark and quasi-evil overlord, players scour the world in search of items of power, foil the plots of "evil" Adventurers, and clean out the dungeons whenever needed, getting themselves into mess after mess with the only way out is to help each other!

The Imp Game is a wonderfully hilarious game for 2 to 5 players of all ages. The Imp Game features a powerful "Failure" mechanic that captures the feeling of inept but stupidly lucky sidekicks, ensuring that success is inevitable, but who succeeds at what?

Mischief & Mayhem! is the first product released for the Imp Game.

56319.name: Ancient Kingdoms: Mesopotamia
56319.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dead Cities in the Desert

A city of unspeakable antiquity, buried for centuries beneath the desert sands, stands revealed deep in the accursed desert known as the Red Waste. Dare you enter The City That Worshipped a Thousand Gods, seeking the treasures and relics of its Hierophants? Beware the lurking terrors of a bygone age!


Treasures of Darkness

Ancient Kingdoms: Mesopotamia is a large setting sourcebook packed with numerous new classes, deities, monsters and magic items, including a series of short adventures. Explore ancient ruins, temples and dungeons of the lost city of Ibnath, and the perilous wilderness areas that surround it. The Ziggurat of the Ghoul-Queen awaits!

Sword & Sorcery books are published under the Open Game License and are 100% compatible with v.3.5 rules and the d20 System.

56320.description:
Frontline General: Spearpoint 1943 is a new fast-playing card wargame that uses tactical Unit Cards, Command Cards, and Damage Cards to simulate plausible frontline combat at a fast pace. Squad-level infantry and individual tanks, artillery, and aircraft form the Tip of the Spear, or Spearpoint, of the battle. Each 20-30 minute game is one intense card-based combat engagement.


Fast-paced two-player World War II squad-level tactical card game with a deck-building element that plays in 30 minutes!



Play tense tactical Situation games or Standard games!



Unit statistics based on years of research yield historically-plausible results with every battle.



Non-CCG deck construction for unlimited replayability.


Components:


Single sheet of rules (11"x17", two-sided)
9 Situations (Download direct or thru BGG)
50 German Unit Cards
50 US Unit Cards
50 Command Cards
25 Damage Cards
4 Dice
Heavy Duty Box


Game info page on Frontlinegeneral.com: http://frontlinegeneral.com/html/spearpoint_1943.html

Expansion Info:


Spearpoint 1943: Eastern Front is the second standalone game in the series and adds all new Russian and German Cards as well as new Command and Damage Cards.



Spearpoint 1943: Village and Defensive Line Map Expansion adds terrain, line of sight, movement, and additional situations.



Frontline General: Spearpoint 1987 is a modern (cold war, 1987-based) variant from designer Jim Day (MBT, IDF, etc.) using the same basic system. It is not compatible with the 1943-based Spearpoint games but uses the same core mechanics.
56320.name: Spearpoint 1943
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Twenty One of The Gaming Gang

56323.name: Instant Spandaus
56323.description:
Fast play air-to-air combat miniatures game for WWI planes similar to the game Instant Thunder and Instant Bandits. The game uses a rectangular grid with playing card suits marking 4 rows and cards K to A marking 14 columns.

Planes have individual flight characteristics for vertical and lateral movement, as well as armament and structural points.

Each turn a card is drawn for each plane to place it onto the grid on the appropriate space. Planes may be able to move to a different space by drawing a new card that must be lower than its movement rating. Thereafter shooting is performed in a similar fashion. At the end of each turn, the planes are removed from the grid, so may reappear on an entirely new angle of attack the following turn.

Rules provide many optional rules and very complete aircraft statistics.

56324.name: Arcane Codex
56324.description:
User summary:

This is the main rulebook for Arcane Codex. It contains
- character creation rules,
- combat rules
- the magic system
- over 80 pages of background information on the campaign world
- 90 pages of spell descriptions
- a collection of magic items
- GM advice
- 30 pages of creature stats and descriptions

The book is not inteded for children as it depicts mature content.

56325.name: Big Dumb Heroes
56325.description:
Publisher's description:

Welcome back to the crazy, upside down, cliched world of The Imp Game with Neo Productions brand new Big, Dumb Heroes! Leave the evil and mischief behind as you create your own epic, bumbling fool! Rid the world of evil monsters, and some not so much evil as they are obnoxious, and steal oodles of treasure, brave fearsome dungeons, and fail more often than not in your attempts to have your name known throughout history!

Big, Dumb Heroes is a follow-up title to 2005's Mischief & Mayhem. Players take on the roles of bumbling heroes instead of imps and explore random dungeons, complete mad-lib quests, and more! This product contains not one, but two PDFs, one for screen reading and appreciation, and one for simplistic printing and sharing! Each 46 page PDF details the original Imp Game system, contains rules for creating heroes, random dungeons and crazy quests, and a mini-beastiary of foes to tackle in your exploits!

Big Dumb Heroes is the perfect title for a light evening of play or as a back-up game for nights when the GM isn't prepared or a player is missing from a serious campaign. Set up and play in less than 10 minutes, game for hours!

56327.name: Arcane Codex Kompendium
56327.description:
User summary:

The Arcane Codex Kompendium contains more additions to the Arcane Codex core rules.

Described herein are:
- new advantages and disadvantages
- new schools of combat and fighting styles
- druidic cirles
- new magic items and artifacts
- weapons, armor, and siege engines
- poisons, drugs, and acids
- optional combat rules
- new skills
- new character advancement options
- new spells and a flexible magic system
- new creatures and rules for creating creatures
- mass combat rules

56328.name: Deutschland in den Schatten II
56328.description:
User summary:

"Deutschland in den Schatten II" (Germany in the Shadows II) is the successor to the Germany Sourcebook. It details the German territories in the year 2062.

56329.name: Schlagschatten
56329.description:
User summary:

"Schlagschatten" (Drop Shadow) is a German Shadowrun adventure collection set in the Germany of 2053. It contains three adventures.

56330.name: Österreichisches Sammelsurium
56330.description:
To do well at Österreichisches Sammelsurium, you'll not only have to hold your own when guessing the answers to various outlandish and often humorous questions about Austria, but also be able to convincingly make up facts on the fly.

Questions are divided into three catgories: Knowledge, Creative and Estimates.

56331.name: FantaCity
56331.description:
User summary:
Contains several battle maps and "Lead Free" Soldiers & Swords miniatures. Apparently different boxes contains different maps and/or miniatures. The section below seems to be common, however.

From the back cover:
"Now and then, when the labyrinth has been cleared, the beasts abated, and the gods appeased, one seeks the company and opportunity of the city amongst others seeking the same. In the realm of the FantaCity, those that have come to escape adventure will lament, and those that have come to find it will revel. Each FantaCity pack offers a diverse mix of 25mm scale floorplans and inhabitants designed to enhance ANY role-playing system."

56332.name: Weapons & Gear
56332.description:
Introduction text:

One of the things that the 4C System rules are sorely lacking is a section on sample equipment. Sure, there are the occasional weapons and vehicles, but for the most part the rules provide gamemasters and players with zero guidance and assistance on weapons and gear.

Enter the 4C System Weapons & Gear series. In this infrequent series, published as I have the time to devote to the system, I plan on detailing a variety of different types of gear, gadgets, and devices, ranging from equipment suitable for near-future campaigns to magic items straight out of a fantasy setting.

56333.name: Milk Run
56333.description:
(Publisher blurb)
Are you ready to head into the unknown at the request of a total stranger for a dubious promise of financial reward? Of course you are...

Milk Run is the first official adventure set in the Alpha Omega universe. Milk Run is a 70 page adventure with full color illustrations, pre made characters, new NPC's, creatures and vehicles. It's designed for 4-5 players for play over 1-2 sessions. Of course you are free to build your own, but we have provided 6 pre-generated characters for you to choose from so you can get started right away!

56334.name: The Villainous and the Vigilant 1
56334.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Villainous and the Vigilant 1 is a 30-page dossier of heroes and villains for the MARVELous retro-clone 4C System. It uses lavish illustrations released under Creative Commons by Storn A Cook.

56335.name: Champions Twenty-Fifth Anniversary Edition
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES...
WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56335.description:
User Summary:

The Champions Twenty-Fifth Anniversary Edition was created by Hero Games to commemorate the Silver Anniversary of the publication of the original edition of Champions.

The print run for this collectible edition was limited to 200 copies. It is very much a labor of love.

Aside from including the entire text of the Hero System Fifth Edition books Champions & Champions Universe, The book contains interviews and reflections from the games creators, most prolific contributors, and biggest fanatics, in a section called The Heroes Speak. Contributors to this section include: Steve Peterson, Ray Greer, George MacDonald, Bruce Harlick, Aaron Allston, Scott Bennie, Patrick E. Bradley, Kenneth Hite, Steve Kenson, Steven S. Long, Phil Masters, Steve Perrin, C.A. Suleiman, Andy Vetromile, Jason Walters, and others.)

As a bonus, n revamped version of the first Champions scenario The Island of Doctor Destroyer is also included.

56336.description:
Klingon Armada is an official conversion of the Star Fleet Universe to the Starmada rules. Players can fight one-on-one duels, but Klingon Armada is particularly suited for fleet engagements. The rules are simple, but not simplistic.

Each turn, players simultaneously write orders for all of their ships, and then the orders are executed in turn order. The mechanics for combat are simple, but there is large amount of variety in the weapon effects. Ships lose effectiveness from damage until they are expanding clouds of debris.

Klingon Armada can be played with miniatures or counters from the Federation Commander series.

This book includes quick-start rules and 40 starship diagrams (from Klingon Border and Klingon Attack).

Additional books with more starships are planned.

Integrates with:

Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
Romulan Armada
56336.name: Klingon Armada

56337.name: Das Schwarze Auge: Abenteuer Basis-Spiel (2nd Edition)
56337.description:
Die Helden des Schwarzen Auges
(The Heroes of the Black Eye)

The Box with the two Core-Rule-Books of the 2nd Editon of DSA, Character-Sheets and the small Adventure "Silvanas Befreiung".

Text from the back of the Box:

Die Welt des »Schwarzen Auges«

In Aventurien, dem fantastischen Land des »Schwarzen Auges«, warten unzählige Abenteuer auf Sie. Allerdings, man muß die Gesetze des »Schwarzen Auges« kennen, sonst ist man verloren. Beginnen Sie deshalb mit der Box »Die Helden des Schwarzen Auges«. Sie enthält die Grundregeln und ein erstes Abenteuer. Dort lesen Sie auch, wie man »Meister des Schwarzen Auges« wird. Mit den »Abenteuer-Büchern« dringt man dann Geschichte für Geschichte in die geheimnisvolle Welt Aventuriens vor. Es gibt »Solo-Abenteuer«, die der »Meister des Schwarzen Auges« moderiert und mit mehreren Spielern erlebt. Aventurische Helden fangen mit der ersten Erfahrungsstufe an. Während eines Abenteuers sammeln die Helden »Abenteuer-Punkte« und steigen so Abenteuer für Abenteuer, Stufe um Stufe auf.

Die Box »Die Helden des Schwarzen Auges« enthält alle Dinge, die Sie für einen perfekten Einstieg in ein phantastisches Rollenspiel benötigen: Sie erfahren, wie Sie Ihrem Helden eine Spielfigur erschaffen und worin seine Stärken, Schwächen und besonderen Begabungen bestehen. Alle Regeln sind so geordnet, daß Sie spielend den Einstieg finden und sich schnell zu einem fortgeschrittenen Rollenspieler entwickeln. Damit Ihre Runde sofort losspielen kann, ist der Box ein komplettes Kurzabenteuer beigegeben.

56338.name: The Pulp Hero Vehicle Sourcebook, Volume I
56338.description:
From the Hero Games website:

The Vehicles Table in Pulp Hero lists dozens of vehicles from the Pulp era, from cars to tramp steamers... in summary form. But sometimes a gamer needs the full-blown character sheet for his Pulp adventurer's luxury auto, biplane, or speedboat!

The Pulp Hero Vehicle Sourcebook, Vol. I satisfies that need. It includes complete character sheets for every vehicle in Pulp Hero that hasn't already been published in The Ultimate Vehicle or The HERO System Vehicle Sourcebook. So strap yourself in and get ready to ride!

User Notes:

This is a Hero Plus Adventure for Pulp Hero. There is no artwork in this pdf.

56339.name: Treasury of Archaic Names
56339.description:
User Summary:
Based on the Judges Guild sourcebook Treasury of Archaic Names by Bill Owen, Treasury of Archaic Names has been revised and updated by Leslie Johnson.

From the back cover:
"This huge 64 page tome provides tables for random generation of olden names, nicknames, titles, town and tavern names for fantasy and science-fiction stories and role-playing games. The English Language and its antecendents such as Celtic, Teutonic, Scandinavian, Latin, and Greek tongues have all been used as sources so that name meanings would be on the fringes of the familiar and exotic simultaneously. A good name will establish a character's personality or an inn or village's atmosphere and history; it encourages a credible rapport and reminds players that all of the characters have a strong self-interested and identity in the game or story.

Over 320,000 possible name combinations!"

56340.name: The College Football Chronology
56340.description:
Actionsims is proud to introduce its latest offering, The College Football Chronology (CFC). CFC features every college team in the history of the USA (along with many foreign colleges) rated in offensive & defensive ability. Teams are also given an overall performance rating. Replay entire historical seasons quickly & accurately, or set up your own fantasy schedules.

Play games with DI, DII, DIII *Universities

Junior/Community Colleges
NAIA teams
Indian Schools
Military Academies
Business Schools, Medical, Dental & Law Schools
Military Base clubs, NTSs, Air *Bases, Infantry & Battleship squads
Parochial Schools & Schools for Mutes & the Deaf
Town Teams, Athletic Clubs, YMCA Teans
Varsity/Alumni/Sophomores/Freshmen squads
Many high school teams from the late 1800s - early 1900s are also included.




Game engine utilizes fast action cards; playing time is about about 30 minutes. Many different drive charts provide for a variety of outcomes. Score sheets for 4 different eras, box score and extra charts: track stats as you play. Charts for 1 & 2-point PATS, hurry up offense, onside kicks, and more. Play matches between different divisions &/or classes, using the included inter-division rating system. Detailed timing system coupled with team strength ratings produces realistic scoring output. Rule changes for differing eras are incorporated, including timing of halves/quarters, point values for scores, PAT rules and overtimes.

56341.name: Action!
56341.description:
User Summary:
Action! is a game created to be both fast and enjoyable. It get most of its inspiration from the world of movies. The players will, for example, be playing an ex cop, a veteran or any other kind of typical hero, and fight against evil bad guys and their plans. It doesn't do anything if the roles get stereotypical, because that's sort of the idea.

Action! is written to be a fun and not to heavy system, and are written with a tongue in cheek mentality.

56342.description:
From the publisher:

Chez Cthulhu brings the horror of Lovecraft's Mythos right into your apartment . . . as if the leftovers from the Pizza with Absolutely Everything weren't bad enough. Work your job – will you be a Morgue Janitor, a Sanitarium Attendant, or a Gravedigger? Buy things to give you Slack. A Straitjacket may be a good choice, but Friendly Tentacles can also be helpful. Oh, and Nookie, don't forget the Nookie. But avoid the Ectoplasmic Slime.

Comportaos como hombres justos.
Vivid como hombres libres.
Luchad con decisión cuando debáis hacerlo.

“Pugna ad Animae Tuae Saluten Consecuendam Parata Est”

Hell has fallen on Earth and I live in it.
With the last bell toll that announced the Year of Our Lord 1000, the Devil’s hordes invaded the world and, in seven days, conquered, captured and razed. Two and half centuries later, humanity´s held captive in the cities of the Demonic Earth, where demons torture, humiliate and tempt to corrupt souls.
But, hiding in forests and mountains, small free human communities live waiting Judgement Day, the Day when the Messiah will return to Earth to claim his own. Until then, the Justs Ones of the Three Religions of the Book, those who God have given fabulous faculties, struggle with the Devil, his hosts and minions, to protect those who love and to fulfil the Almighty’s designs.
A world of Darkness, nightmare creatures, great acts of faith, epic deeds of the human spirit. In that all you´ll be submerged in this uncertain road you have decided to walk.
My counsel is this:
Act like Just men.
Live as a free men.
Fight with decision when you must.
Your soul is, in fact, your only and most precious possession, the only thing that is worth in this world of darkness. He left it in your care; watch over it with honor and faith, keep it pure. Stand alert: today, like never before, Evil’s lurking...

56386.description:
E4 (Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion) is the first official expansion for Experiment.

This expansion gives the players new options to choose and new strategies to play the game.

E4 introduces a new card type: the special lab card.

Special lab cards are mysterious, no player may look at them before taking them. You never know what you are going to get ... it might be a double colour joker but it can also be a normal one colour flask or even an empty Erlenmeyer.
The card remains hidden for your opponents so they won't know what you have until you use it.
An empty Erlenmeyer can even give you in certain situations the edge of winning a close game with half a point.

E4 also adds 6 new secret lab cards for even more fun.
56386.name: Empty Erlenmeyer Experiment Expansion

56388.name: Extreme Paranoia
56388.description:
From the back of the book:

A huge 128-page must-have rules supplement for Paranoia by the Traitor Recycling Studio.

Illustrated by Jim Holloway.

Up to now your players have been Troubleshooters of lowly Red Security Clearance. Now, in Extreme Paranoia, they can become characters of any clearance from Orange up to the powerful Violet - and they'll still be paranoid!

- Orange - TV actors in loyalty-inspiring Alpha Complex sitcoms (That's My Commie!) and dramas (CSI: CSI Sector).
- Yellow - Assistant retail sales managers - no, wait, don't put the book down! It's harrowing true-to-life pressure, but funny!
- Green - Emergency Disaster Response Teams, celebrities who help out at disaster scenes (often by creating them).
- Blue - Internal Security troopers with awesome armor, brain-curdling weaponry and utterly impossible assignments.
- Indigo - Secret agents infiltrating traitorous societies, R&D mad scientists plotting revenge, revenge I tell you, hahaha!
- Violet - Executives who are rolling in money, run entire portfolios of service firms, and are unbelievably, deeply screwed.

Plus new living quarters, social clubs, a tour of AlphaNet, and a nerve-wracking trip to the Happy Fun Job Placement Center!

BONUS! New Mandatory Bonus Duties like the advertising & branding officer, financial officer and agent provocateur!

- Everything you need to maintain fear and ignorance at all security clearances from Orange through Violet! Explore new levels of paranoid hilarity!
- New Troubleshooter duties and secret society activities for all clearances above Red!
- Things to buy, Internal Security dossiers, and more!
- Unsullied by tedious game fiction from eager yet dismally untalented novices!

56391.name: Monsters, Magic & Sorcery
56391.description:
From the back of the book:

MMS is the first major expansion supplement to Quest of the Ancients. Within the pages of this tome shall be found an assortment of creatures, both friendly and deadly. Is your gaming group ready to face the xenophobic dog men of Arwin, or the insane shadow liche? Who has the courage to withstand the kemp of Asmodeus, or the widsom to outwit the capricious, undead groat?

Treasures too abound within from the Ring of Ice Crystals and the Hand of Countess Vendeleki, to Culharnen's Mist Blade, the Rose Cloak of Arleta, and over 60 others. Also featured are details on magic scrolls, spell books and much more!

56392.name: Outpost 19
56392.description:
A science fiction adventure

From the back cover -

.. the designation of Vascon Corporation's archaeological research station on the frontier colony world of Jeterieff V, a site that has been quarantined because of the outbreak of an unidentified disease. Can the medical trouble-shooters scrambled via Gate from the Tripoint Facility Medical Center contain the outbreak? Or will they discover that something more sinister is behind the crisis?

56394.name: HarnMaster Character Profile
56394.description:
User summary:

The HarnMaster Character Profile is a shrink-wrapped pad of 50 one-sided character sheets.

56395.name: Basic Magic
56395.description:
From the Chaosium site:

This work presents four core Chaosium magic systems developed for use with Basic Roleplaying. Here is Spirit Magic, derived from your ancestors and the spirits of old; Divine Magic, come from the gods; Sorcery, developed from within; and Ceremony, made powerful through ritual and chant.

56396.name: Magic Of Glorantha
56396.description:
From the back cover

Glorantha in its Second Age is a world steeped in powerful magic. From the common incantations of the runes, to the reality-breaking spells of the God Learners and the warped mysticism of the Empire of Wyrm's Friends, magic permeates every layer of Gloranthan life.

The abuse of these mighty powers is accelerating Glorantha toward apocalypse, yet the two greatest culprits - the God Learners and the wyrmfriends - refuse to mitigate their acts of corruption and blind zealotry. Yet while they are ascendant, their magical prowess is without challenge.

Magic of Glorantha explores the most essential of these eldritch practices, providing detailed explanations and rules for Dragon Magic, God Learner Sorcery, and the mysteries of HeroQuesting. Additional information is also provided on the subtleties of wyrmfriend society, dragonspeaker cults, and the mechamagical enhancements of the Zistorites. Lastly, Magic of Glorantha provides character assassinations of the major Dragonspeakers and sorcerous lords of the Middle Sea Empire, including vital advice on how to deal with and serve these prodigious magicians.

56397.name: Immortal Intro Prep Kit
56397.description:
User summary:

The Immortal Intro Prep Kit is a free quick-start rules set for Immortal Millenium, including a two-page sample adventure.

From the back of the book:

It is the end of the modern world, the return to dominance of immortal beings that existed before human civilization. The myths that humanity holds dear are crumbling as ancient gods rise from their secret places to fight a final war with the forces of darkness. A new age of legend is dawning, terrible, magical, and breathtaking.

How will you handle the challenge?

An apocalyptic new vision of IMMORTAL has arrived with the combined talents of veteran RPG designers Paul Beakley and Steve Winter, alongside IMMORTAL's original creator, Ran Ackels. Completely revised, check out IMMORTAL's entrancing supernatural background combined with an updated game system streamlined to let you charge right into the razor's edge action and an ever-tightening web of intrigue.

56398.name: Alpha Complexities
56398.description:
From the back of the book:

Mission Alert!

Attention Troubleshooters! Your friend The Computer has selected you for the privilege of participating in a suicide mission of marginal importance.

You will be assigned to masquerade as a crack team of communist traitors in a live ammunition practice maneuver with 12 elite vulture squadrons. As fatalities are expected to be overwhelming. All clones in each family will report to facility rapid reinforcement.

Please proceed to troubleshooter headquarters. Please bring all personal effects in a small box. Failure to report merits summary executing by slooooow torture.

Thank you for your cooperation.

56399.name: The Tome of Gray Mysteries
56399.description:
user summary:

The Tome of Gray Mysteries contains 47 neutral and common magic spells.

56400.description:
There are 32 cards devided in 8 groups of 4 cards. With these cards the players can play 5 different games.

Alle Viere: Every player gets four cards in theis hands. The other cards are placed in the middle of the table. The game is played like 'Go Fish.'

Gleich und Gleich: Starting with the youngest. The cards are placed face down on the table. each player tries to find the same kind of cards. Played like Memory.

Eins, Zwei, Drei: The deck is shuffled and every player gets 6 cards. The other cards are placed on the table. In a players turn he/she gets a card and discards a card. The object of the game is to collect 3 or 4 cards of the same kind.

Aufgepaßt: This game is all about 'reaction'. every player gets a deck of cards. Simutaneously the players turn their first card face up. The players who have the same picture, tries to place their hand on the other player card. The first player who gets the card wins both cards.

Angeschmiert: All the cards but one are shuffled and devided among the players. At the players turn, he/she takes a card from an another player. When the player collects a pair, its placed open on the table.
56400.name: Jetzt geht's los, Kleiner Rabe

56402.name: Legends of the Dark Ages
56402.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Welcome to the fall of civilzation. In 476 the greatest empire the world has ever known lies in ruins. Through the rubble stride barbarians, conquerors who will remake the world of Europe in their own image through blood and fire and iron.

Welcome to the Dark Ages.

Legends of the Dark Ages brings the world of Europe from the fall of Rome to the death of Charlemagne to your favorite role playing game. Using mechanics introduced in RPGObjects' Ennie nominated Legends of Excalibur and further popularized in Legends of the Samurai, Legends of the Dark Ages brings this grim era to life.

Legends of the Dark Ages features:

* 5 bloodlines of humanity: Slave, Serf, Barbarian, Lesser Nobility and Royalty.
* 12 new core classes: Charlatan, Hermit, Marauder, Mercenary, Monk, Noble, Nomad, Priest, Seer, Skald, Soldier, Thief.
* New weapons and armor detailing the wrought iron weapons in use during the dark ages, as well as the monetary system of the times. The equipment section also features the two exotic materials used in the dark ages, meteoric iron and Damascus steel.
* A complete history of the age from 476 to 814.

56403.name: Activity Turbo
56403.description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition you have only 60 seconds to describe the 4 expressions on the card.

56404.name: Legends of the Dark Ages: The Hamlet of Iona
56404.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Hamlet of Iona is an adventure location sourcebook for Legends of the Dark Ages. In addition to detailing the Hamlet itself as a home base for the characters’ adventures, Hamlet of Iona provides numerous NPCs to serve as lords, contacts or servants for the PCs, and some short scripted adventures.

This adventure supplement includes:

* Hamlet Details and a low level starter adventure.
* NPC stats for both Legends of the Dark Ages and Excalibur.
* Beautiful color Hamlet map from Kristian Richards.
* Color Sewer Map created from Skeletonkey Games' Sewer Passage and Sewer Tunnels e-adventure tiles.
* Bonus sewer e-tile from Skeletonkey Games.
* 2 PDF versions: Landscape (screen viewing), Portrait (for printing)

56405.description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where players have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition the words are familiar to children and they have to describe as much of the 4 words as they can in 60 seconds.
56405.name: Activity Turbo Junior

56406.name: Activity Club-Edition
56406.description: Adult version of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This edition comes with 770 new, erotic phrases.

56407.name: 20 Jahre Activity
56407.description: The twentieth anniversary edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This edition comes with 2500 new ideas.

56408.name: Let's Party!
56408.description:
A mix of Activity and Tick Tock Boom!
The Activity cards are labeled on the back with numbers from 3-5, this gives the number of fields that you pull with the right answer on. The terms of the front are marked with symbols for drawing the type of representation, mime or explain in words.
The Tick Tock Boom cards show combinations of letters that must be contained in the searched words. It mixes all the cards and plays one standard Activity, until a Tick Tock Boom card appears. Now is a dice where the letters in the word must stand, the bomb is started and who is called a correct term, passes the bomb. The bomb may draw the team that gave the last word, four squares forward, the team, the bomb exploded, goes back a field. In the last four fields with the correct solution is always drawn only one field. The team that first reaches the goal box wins.

56409.name: Activity Travel
56409.description: Travel version of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing.

56410.description: Small version of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This edition comes with 660 new ideas.
56410.name: Activity kompakt

56411.description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This edition is for small children. The questions are divided into different categories that respond individually to the skills of the children.
56411.name: Activity My First

56412.name: Honfoglaló Családi Társasjáték
56412.description: The family edition of the game Honfoglaló. Players can conquer areas (counties of Hungary) by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) But also you have to choose a good strategy in order to conquer the whole country. This edition contains 1200 questions for children and 1200 questions for grown-ups.

56413.name: Ashcan Edition (Volume 1, Issue 1 - Apr 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Getting the Gear: Covert Ops Phantom
56413.description:
Table of Contents:

News Flash
Wanted Posters
Profiles
Retro View
Getting the Gear
New Powers

56416.description:
Special edition of the game Honfoglaló, where players can conquer areas (counties of Hungary) by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) But also you have to choose a good strategy in order to conquer the whole country.

In this special edition there are 2160 new questions, which help to prepare to the final exam at the end of the high school in Hungary.
56416.name: Érettségiző honfoglaló társasjáték

56418.name: Bloody Ol' Muddy
56418.description:
From the back of the book:

Here's Mud In Yer Eye!

Actually, mud may be the least of your posse's problems when they're messing about on the mighty Mississippi River - especially near the mysterious mound city of Cahokia.
This strange collection of earthen mounds near St. Louis, Missouri, has baffled the best archaeologists from Back East, the identity of its builders lost to the mists of time. It's a deserted city shunned by people and animals alike.

Until now, that is. Something odd is going on in Cahokia - something sinister. The mound city's ancient builders have returned from a journey that's taken them outside the boundaries of time itself - and they're not the friendly folks they used to be!

This adventure for the Origins Award-winning Deadlands The Weird West roleplaying game pits your heroes against these ancient people and their mad plan to save the world from the horror of the Reckoning-by destroying it utterly!

56420.name: The Way of the Righteous
56420.description:
From the back of the book:

Faith and a .44!

That's what the blessed use to overcome the forces of darkness. Those with true faith and the blessing of the Almighty can walk on water, call down holy fire from the Heavens, and sometimes even raise the dead!
Of course a .44 is handy for dealing with more mundane threats - such as the followers of the Enemy.

Way of the Righteous is the class book for the Blessed. Inside you'll find new gifts and miracles, and the most powerful arcane powers in Deadlands - Divine Interventions. You'll also find two new prestige classes - Monster Slayers and Witch Hunters, as well as detailed information on the enemies of the righteous, prophetic visions, and just how to sort the black sheep from your hero's flock.

As if that weren't enough, Way of the Righteous contains a full-length adventure - The Mission, one of the creepiest encounters ever written for the Weird West!
Way of the Righteous requires Deadlands D20, and the Player's Handbook from Wizards of the Coast.

56422.name: Í skóinn
56422.description: A single track game that is included with the album Í skóinn by the designer. Players roll and move their pawns (not included) and follow the instructions if needed. The first one to the finish space wins the game.

56423.name: Maximum Damage
56423.description:
From the back of the book:

You know, being a prop manager isn't the easiest job. Each movie demands bigger and better guns, larger and louder explosions, and at the end if the day the director jst wants to see...

MAXIMUM DAMAGE

Preview Clip

Rambozo prowls the jungle on yet another grueling mission deep in the heart of yet another third-world communist-satellite country. This time, he seeks to free a group of hostages consisting of POW soldiers, MIA pilots, CIA operatives, FBI directors, KFC managers, the English patient, the retired colonel who's his ex-mentor's cousin's former roommate, a little old lady from Pasadena, and a fish called Wanda. It's a dirty job, but somebody's gotta do it. Too bad he drew the short straw.

Suddenly, enemies emerge from the shadows. Armed with submachineguns, assault rifles, automatic pistols, frag grenades, surface-to-surface missiles, slingshots, pepper sprays, and survival knives with functioning compasses, they open fire in Rambozo's general direction, showering the terrain with hot lead.

Undaunted, Rambozo steps out of cover and blasts away...

It's Damage Time.

MAXIMUM DAMAGE is your sourcebook to bring action flick mayhem to life, with a multitude of unreal arsenals so macho, your Popularity increases just for powering these babies up! Hollywood weapons, new Repertoire to ensure heroic triumph, tricks to spice up a fight scene... Hey, what more can you ask for, other than more foes to blow up/mangle/mutilate/fry/disintegrate?

A supplement full of guns, explosives and other props for America's #1 Action Hero Game.

56424.name: Zoo-Botanica Aventurica
56424.description:
User Summary:
This is a source book for DSA 4th edition about all living things on Aventurien.

In it you´ll find information about animals, monsters, intelligent and magic creatures and plants. There are no informations about demons.

56425.name: LARP Pocket Players Guide
56425.description:
[from the Introduction]
When you're playing a Live Action Roleplaying Game (LARP), you don't want to have to go find a game master every time you want to do something, or have to carry around a big rulebook or a binder full of notes. All of this gets in the way of the roleplaying.

This guide will help you in many ways. It's a handy rules reference. It's a place to record your character's STATs and Abilities. It's a notebook to keep track of the people and clues you come across during the game. And it's got hints for building characters, preparing for the game, and how to have the most fun while you're playing.

56426.name: Clipping Wings
56426.description: Adventure Description from front page "Many secrets lie hidden in the obsidian darkness of the Land of Black Ice. The fate of the afflicted children of a Keoish barony may rest in the hands of a few adventurers willing to brave the unknown. But are forces in the North hiding a bigger threat? An adventure for characters of Average Party Level 2 through 14."

56427.name: Efferds Wogen
56427.description:
(User summary)
This sourcebook gives information about the seas and oceans of Aventurien, present and ancient folks on and under the sea, sailing and trading, fleets of the different nations of Aventurien, famous persons connected to the seas and myths and secrets of the sea.

56428.description: Rummino is a variation of a rummy game that although has a simple concept of matching requires strategy and forethought. The game comes with 92 tiles with 5 suits (clubs, hearts, diamonds, spades and stars)and 5 ranks (9, 10, jack, Queen, King, Ace). Each player starts with 7 tiles which are used to score the most points by creating sets and runs. If players are able to finish off a run or set, that player receives double or triple the points for that round. Rummino is a unique rummy game that is easy to learn yet strategically challenging to even the most advanced gamers.
56428.name: Rummino

rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…

56430.name: Katudi 2
56430.description:
This children's matching game, published by Djeco, has 3 sets of large player mat type cards with busy, whimsical illustrations which are divided by a grid, and a set of smaller, matching, image tiles for each illustration. One player draws a tile and describes the image on it while the others search for the matching grid space on their player mats. The first to correctly identify the matching space wins the tile, and the player with the most matching tiles at the end of the game wins.

This is a great game for children who are developing oral language skills or vocabulary, and would be fun with any age to practice a foreign language.

The game rules come in 8 languages and the game itself is language independent.

The game suggests an age of 6 and up, but I think that this game could easily be used with much younger children.
